alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Greene; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 7:01PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Ulster and southern Greene Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 700 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Phoenicia, or 11 miles south of Hunter, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Kenneth L Wilson Campground around 710 PM EDT. West Hurley around 715 PM EDT. Woodstock around 720 PM EDT. Hurley around 725 PM EDT. Kingston, Saugerties, Lake Katrine and Saugerties South around 730 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Rolling Meadows, Quarryville, Glenford, Palentown, Atwood, Manorville, Katsbaan, Oliverea, Shultis Corners and Sweet Meadows. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 19 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Greene; Western Ulster
